page.title: 05BLACKMORE VALE MIXED FARMING
page.content: The A357 Sturminster-Stalbridge road crosses this area roughly S to N with Waterloo Lane branching off westwards. Caundle Brook flows W to E in the south of the area.Rough enclosed grass land is grazed by a flock of 120 ewes. Better pastures northwards support a dairy herd.The north-east area is open grassland and gardens belonging to a large private estate.No farming. Very few people live here,no retired folk.Two children go to school in Sherborne.Some people work locally on the dairy and beef farms.Others travel outside to work professionally. This area has a private bus running from Shillingstone to Sherborne thrice daily but every householder needs his own car to make life easier. With no amenities this is not an area to attract the elderly for retirement nor young couples with children.
